creditline: The Christina N. and Swan J. Turnblad Memorial Fund
description: Storage box for this object is in D10 MS
text: Zitzmann's literal interpretation of a tulip in glass is part of an international period of glass experimentation that was part of the Art Nouveau movement, and that resulted in the widespread interpretation of floral and foliate forms. This purely decorative goblet is very much in the spirit of Louis Comfort Tiffany's floriform vases.
title: Long-stemmed goblet
